title: [Idea] Ultimate Fishing enchants [Over 150 positive reactions] (Water dungeon link (other post)
body:
Okay, i saw a thread, with a idea, about more ultimate enchants. But he/she forgot about fishing ultimate enchants.​
And thats why im making this!


Double Trouble: (fishing rod)
Tier 1: Gives a 3% chance to fish up 2 (of the same) sea creatures instead of just 1
Tier 2: Gives a 6% chance to fish up 2 (of the same) sea creatures instead of just 1
Tier 3: Gives a 9% chance to fish up 2 (of the same) sea creatures instead of just 1
Tier 4: Gives a 12% chance to fish up 2 (of the same) sea creatures instead of just 1
Tier 5: Gives a 15% chance to fish up 2 (of the same) sea creatures instead of just 1



Lucky night: (fishing rod)

Tier 1: Can't fish up squid at the day, but at night, you will catch a squid every 3rd catch
Tier 2: Can't fish up squid at the day, but at night, you will catch a squid every 2 catch
Tier 3; Can't fish up squid at the day, but at night, you will catch a squid every catch
(you will fish up a squid AND a other thing (example: You can fish up a sea creature and a squid)
(NOTE: you will fish up normal squids, not night squids. You can't fish up 2 squids.)
(lucky night only works on public islands)

Treasure tracker: (fishing rod)
Tier 1: You will now have a +50% (of your normal) chance to fish up treasures. You will also gain 100% more gold from treasures
Tier 2: You will now have a +100% (of your normal) chance to fish up treasures. You will also gain 200% more gold from treasures


Scared fisher: (fishing rod)
Tier 1: Sea creatures will mis 10% of their health, when caught.
Tier 2: Sea creatures will mis 20% of their health, when caught .
Tier 3: Sea creatures will mis 30% of their health, when catched, and deal 10% less damage.


Sea Expert: (fishing rod)
Tier 1: For every 1 mil damage you have dealed to sea creatures, you will gain a 0,2% scc (sea creature chance) bonus (capped at 5/10%) 
(let me now what you meen (5 % or 10 % cap))



Stunner (fishing rod)
Tier 1: You will now stun your sea creatures in 3 seconds, right after you fished them up (so they can't attack)
Tier 2: You will now stun your sea creatures in 5 seconds, right after you fished them up (so they can't attack)



The real fisher (fishing rod)
Tier 1: You can't catch up anything else, than fish, but you will now gain 3x times more fish
Tier 2: You can't catch up anything else, than fish, but you will now gain 6x times more fish
Tier 3: You can't catch up anything else, than fish, but you will now gain 9x times more fish
Tier 4: You can't catch up anything else, than fish, but you will now gain 12x times more fish
Tier 5: You can't catch up anything else, than fish, but you will now gain 15x times more fish



Hard work (fishing rod)
Tier 1: For every 10 fishing speed you will get 1 SCC instead of the 10 fishing speed(you will loose them) (SCC= sea creature chance)

Tier 2:For every 5 fishing speed you will get 1 SCC instead of the 10 fishing speed(you will loose them) (SCC= sea creature chance)
(good work, takes time)


(original idea by @France_best_country )
God fisher (fishing rod)
Tier 1: After fishing up 7 times, without getting a sea creature, your chance will be doubled (doesn't stack)
Tier 2: After fishing up 6 times, without getting a sea creature, your chance will be doubled (doesn't stack)
Tier 3: After fishing up 5 times, without getting a sea creature, your chance will be doubled (doesn't stack)
Tier 4: After fishing up 4 times, without getting a sea creature, your chance will be doubled (doesn't stack)
Tier 5: After fishing up 3 times, without getting a sea creature, your chance will be doubled (doesn't stack)
(The double chance, will reset after fishing up a sea creature)
(if you have any idea, for a new name, to this or any other enchant, feel free to reply!)
(The original idea for this enchant, by @France_best_country )
(with some few changes, by me)



Spoiler: How to obtain the enchants



A new dungeon will be added, called The Sea empire.

Double trouble is from: f4, from the boss' named: Twins from the deep. This boss will be two monsters, running around, and damaging you and your team.
Ability (boss) : To damage them you need to damage 1 of them, and then you need to damage the other 1, in 10 seconds or less. If you failed that the boss will heal back, to the amount of life, it had before you hitted it (more info will come, if i realese a thread with The sea empire.

The rest of them are from f 1-3, and are rare items found in the chest's at the end of them.



Thats whas all for now, feel free to leave a message about, what you think about this thread!



(also hypixel should add a ultimate player enchant, called "Ultimate Idiot", so ppl could feel what it meens to be me)

title: Skyblock 2nd Server?
body: As Skyblock is constantly growing with hundreds, maybe even thousands of new players coming in every day. As it has been potentially a year since Skyblock was first released, many OG players have been grinding since the start, causing newer players to have a really hard time getting into the game. I think that many smaller servers such as Classic Games, Mini Walls, and BedWars/SkyWars Hubs could be replaced with a second Skyblock server. This could be a brand new server that Default ranks could access more easily, which would be great! Also, everyone couldn't access their main Skyblock profiles on the second server. It would make for a MUCH better metagame, and already invested players could stay on main Skyblock!

title: [IDEA] New archer setup for f6
body:
Hi. I recently came up with this idea, and want someone to test it, cuz I'm broke af. 

Suggestion: keep this as a secondary set for killing minibosses faster.

Target: single

Most effective against:
Yellow room mobs
Sadan (boss phase, giant phase)
Livid
Minibosses (when not impeded by other mobs)

Incredibly bad at:
Tanking
Clearing rooms

Gear: Werewolf + lvl 80+ tiger (preferably leg, epic works too)

Your 8 slots should be filled with:
Ice spray/voodoo
Dungeon orb
Florid/ornate
Last breath
Bonemerang

3 epic machine gun bows
(Keep machine gun bows, dungeon stone, last breath, and bonemerang in a row, with last breath being first in the row and bonemerang being last)

Strategy: freeze/slow miniboss, shoot it twice with last breath, and then activate the stone and all the machine gun bows while looking directly at the miniboss. 

Once all abilities have been activated, spam bonemerang and last breath.

This will get you a lot of damage if you have 100+ ferocity, which you should in werewolf.

title: SkyBlock Enhanced | Hypixel Skyblock Modpack - Version 1.0 Released!
body:
So this may get lost in the endless flow of posts saying "NeRf FroZen BlaZe ArmoR" or "I'Ve FouNd a GamEbReakIng GliTch", but I've come to the conclusion that as a community, we need a modpack that refines this online cobblestone mining simulator into a real RPG, the way it should be.
I've taken some time to think about what Mods would make Skyblock feel special.
I have looked at what makes an RPG so immersive. This is mainly the graphics, the soundtrack, the ambience, etc.
I have looked at many Minecraft mods and came up with the best solution to this I can.
I even installed a Skyblock resourcepack to give the items custom textures, however, I know some people prefer the PvP texturepack feel, so I've tried to cater to everyone.
There’s only 18 mods included so far, so let me know if you have any ideas.
Just watch the trailer to see what you think:






So this modpack has many features, I'll list a few here:


Custom Soundtrack to Enhance the RPG Feel.
Custom textures for 99% of the items in Skyblock
Shaders and visuals for low to high-end systems
Dynamic ambient noise which changes to match your environment.
Updated for every Skyblock Addons update so you never need to go out of your way to update
Zealot counter to keep track of eyes and kills
AFK FPS Reducer to save power when AFKing.
Also some people in the comments seem to be confused about what mods are actually present in the pack, so these are what’s in the modpack as of release 0.7.4.

Ambience
AutoTip
BetterFPS
Blur
CustomMainMenu
Dynamic Surroundings
Foamfix
Fullbright
ItemPhysic Lite
MouseDelayFix
NoCloseMyChat
Optifine
Resource Loader
Shoulder Surfing
Sidebar Mod
Skyblock Addons
FPS Reducer
ZealotCounter


So that's about it. I think the trailer speaks for itself. If you think this is something that interests you,
head over to https://www.technicpack.net/modpack/skyblock-enhanced-hypixel.1577429 to download it!

The reason I have used technicpack rather than just releasing a mod folder is so that it will automatically update for you when I modify the pack. I will not release it as a mod folder. Technic is a trusted resource and allows for easy updating of the modpack. 

I do not take any credit for any of the mods in this modpack.
Thanks,
trolliver.

title: Necron Boss Fight [High-Effort Post] [140+ Positive Reactions]
body:
In my mind, the Necron boss fight is meant to be an elegant and difficult boss fight that is not meant to be completed really quickly.
It would have multiple phases.

Note: It is highly recommended to have no duplicate classes for a phase in the fight.


Spoiler: Phase 1



Phase 1:
Necron: Enough of this. I grow tired of your weak amusement.
Lost Adventurer: No, please!
*Necron smites the LA*
Necron: Now, who's next? I do hope you can keep me entertained for at least a while.
(First time going in the dungeon Necron dialogue :) 
Necron: Ah. Yes. I've heard of you adventurers, smiting each of my wonderful generals floor after floor. Every time I expect you to fail and every time I am disappointed. And yet, I'm overjoyed. I'm overjoyed because an irritating pest will finally be eradicated!

In Phase 1, Necron summons hordes of mobs from every angle. The objective of this phase is to damage Necron to 80% health while not dying. Necron has different states where only a specific class can hit him (Notably this is why no duplicates is recommended.)
The 5 states are:
Necron: Your blades fall to my splendour! No-one but a mage could leave a scratch on me!
Necron: Your health pales in comparison to mine! No-one but a tank could hurt my pride!
Necron: Your weapons lay decaying from my wonderful barrier! Nothing but an arrow from an Archer could leave a scar!
Necron: Your magic is useless against me! Unless a berserker struck me with his sword, I should be immortal!
Necron: Your healing is so inferior! Only a healer could damage my reputation!

Necron switches states every 15 seconds, giving ample time for each class to do damage.





Spoiler: Phase 2.1 - Bonzo



Phase 2.1:
After Necron drops 20% HP (Note, I have no idea how much he's going to have so I'm putting it in percentage.)

Necron: I notice your power grows as you crawl the dungeon. Your teamwork makes your strength amplified as you take blessings from my chests. MY chests! It's time for you to feel the consequences of looting what you shouldn't touch.

For every blessing you find, Necron reduces your health by 2%. This can be DEVASTATING. Notably, if you take no blessings throughout the dungeon run, the maximum score you'd ever get is an S.

This is a really big phase, as it goes through every single boss again.
You get 3 blessings after beating each boss. You can see the items that are in your chests before deciding if you want to take the loot or go to the next phase. Taking the loot ends the run.

Necron: How come you defeated Bonzo? I know he's weak, but he managed to become a general for a reason. Let's replay that fight!
(You get teleported to the Bonzo fight.)
Bonzo: Thank you for the chance to redeem yourself. Die flashily! (Yes. One Piece reference)
Bonzo has learned how to teleport between each of the pillars you see in the Bonzo room. He also has a significant increase in health and damage. Bonzo is the easiest boss to fight in this phase, but he is not easy. Each time he teleports to a pillar, he stops for exactly 5 seconds and sends out a barrage of balloons. When he is at 50% health, he only stays at each pillar for 4 seconds and shoots balloons twice as fast.





Spoiler: Phase 2.2 - Scarf



Phase 2.2:
After Bonzo is defeated, Necron gives you a choice:
Necron: I am impressed. You managed to defeat my clown! You can quit here and take new and improved items from Floor 1. Alternatively, you can continue on to Scarf's reincarnation. I know he's eager.

Loot you can get:
Cursed Bonzo Staff : The cursed bonzo staff costs 0 mana to cost and has no cooldown. It notably does as much damage as a 5 star spirit sceptre without being starred.
Painted Iron: 9 of these Painted Iron items will form a Party Cannon, which can be shot at a 5 second cooldown for 1000 mana and does a LOT of damage.

Scarf Fight:
Scarf: You told me to train for another 100 years if I wanted to defeat you. I got started, and now I'm here. Its time to dance.

Scarf has the ability to summon 5 EXACT COPIES of the 5 player's stats and damage. Meanwhile, he has increased health and damage, and shoots the soul sand spikes occasionally, slowing all the players and debuffing them. When he hits 50% HP, he revives all the copies (if theyve died) and increases their speed by 300%.

When Scarf dies, he says:
Scarf: 'Mother... I'll finally be with you again...' (yikes thats kinda deep)





Spoiler: Phase 2.3 - Professor



Phase 2.3:
After Scarf is defeated, Necron gives you the same choice.
Necron: 'I'm impressed with the way you keep going at my generals. That poor Scarf lost his mother in a terrible accident. Didn't stop him from dying. You can take the loot from this area, or continue on. The Professor is ready to school you.'

Loot you can get:
Scarf's Diary: This is an epic dungeon item talisman. It seems Scarf really held this dear to his chest.
Ridiculously Wise: This is an Ultimate Enchant that reduces the mana cost of items by 7.5% per level, and can go up to level 10.

Professor Fight:
Professor: I'm ready to teach this class. Are you ready to learn a lesson?

The Professor is in the middle of teaching a class to a school of guardians. The guardians swarm the players, zapping them and stunning them in place. The Professor is stuck in a state of being transformed into a guardian, and occasionally shoots lasers, drops TNT, smites everyone, or just heals everything. He is completely invincible until the guardians are dead, in which case he triggers the four abilities of his guardians (sans healing) thrice as fast. Health and damage is increased etc etc.

When the Professor dies, he says:
Professor: Hopefully my students take my teachings with them and remember me after I die...





Spoiler: Phase 2.4 - Thorn



Phase 2.4:
After the Professor is defeated:
Necron: 'Your power is certainly unparalleled. The last batch of adventurers didn't even make it past Bonzo. You can stop here, and take the items from the Professor, or continue on to the next phase.'

Loot you can get:
Metamorphosis Armour: This is a buffed up version of adaptive that can be worn on any class. It gains 2 strength for every F3 completion you have, up to (insert number here) per piece.
Metamorphosis Blade: This is a buffed up version of the Adaptive Blade that does (x) amount of damage per hit.
Super Serum: This is a REQUIREMENT to defeat F6-10 Necron-ified bosses. Using one Super Serum makes the bosses vulnerable, as without using the Super Serum they are completely invulnerable. It costs 1mil to get it. (yay. deflation!!)

Thorn Fight:
Thorn: I appreciate you coming to give another round of entertainment. But it seems my crowd wont take this one sitting down.

In the thorn fight, lost adventurers, frozen adventurers and shadow assassins all come, paired with the constant spirit animals flowing down. The Spirit Bear has become corrupted and attacks twice as fast. Upon killing the Spirit Bear, Thorn automatically gets damaged so you don't need to worry about hitting shots. Each death enrages the mobs, making them 10% faster. Thorn himself joins the fight, shooting fireballs that deal 2500 True Damage per hit, but move pretty slowly.

When Thorn dies, he says:
Thorn: At least it was fun. Please don't hurt the animals, we vegans would hate to see that happen.





Spoiler: Phase 2.5 - Livid



Phase 2.5:
After Thorn is defeated:
Necron: 'Livid is, well, livid. Meet him in the next room, or grab the loot from here. Although I recommend bringing something special, otherwise you might not survive.'

Loot you can get:
Pulsating Spirit Wing: Crafting three of these will make a Pulsating Spirit Sceptre, which costs 100 mana per use and deals (x) amount of damage per hit.
Pulsating Spirit Bone: Crafting this will make a Pulsating Bonemerang, which has no distance limit and comes back regardless of hitting a wall. It also does (x) amount of damage per hit, increasing by 10% each time it hits a consecutive enemy in one throw.
Super Serum

NOTE: From here on out, there is absolutely no way to kill the bosses without using a Super Serum. If you lose the fight, the Super Serum is gone for good. It takes one Super Serum per fight continuing on.
Notably, it is impossible to kill the bosses with F9+ gear, and you would need the special items from the previous floors.

Livid Fight:
Livid: I feel amazing. I feel immortal. Don't you?
If even one party member has a Super Serum, this is the opportunity to right click it and multiply every party member's stats by 10. You can do this in earlier floors, but this is basically necessary to fight F5-10 copies.

Livid spawns 9 clones that are super buffed up. When a clone is sub (x) amount of health, they teleport away to regenerate at a rate of (x) per second. This means it is impossible to use cheese tactics such as the eagle strat as the lower HP livids will TP away. You have to be able to chase and track down each Livid. Notably, you have to kill all 9 to win the fight, and they don't respawn.





Spoiler: Phase 2.6 - Sadan



Phase 2.6:
Necron: 'It astonishes me that you found my serum. I'm kind of angry. Well, Sadan should take care of you just as good. That is, if you choose to meet him.'

Loot you can get:
Flawless Livid Dagger: This is a livid dagger that grants 50 ferocity on top of 100 cc and 100 attack speed. It also has (x) damage and strength.
Flawless Shadow Fury: This is a shadow fury that costs no mana and has no cooldown. It also has (x) damage and strength.
Livid Goggles - Livid Robes - Livid Leggings - Livid Boots: This is an upgraded Shadow Assassin set. It spawns a clone of yourself that does significant portions of damage and takes all mob aggro off you until your clone is dead.
Super Serum
Ultra Swarm - Just swarm but 5x better

Sadan Fight:
Sadan: Are you ready to die, puny humans?
If even one party member has a Super Serum, this is the opportunity to right click it and multiply every party member's stats by 10. You can do this in earlier floors, but this is basically necessary to fight F5-10 copies.

Sadan is ready to fight. His 4 giants are standing, and his main body is also there. You don't need to kill the other 4 giants, but they constantly harass you. Sadan's main giant does significant portions of damage, and he has a 5th giant called the Missile Man all the way at the other side of the room. He cannot move, but at the 2 minute mark starts sending huge arrays of missiles that all do true damage. The idea is to either kill the Missile Man or finish Sadan within two minutes.





Spoiler: Phase 2.7 - Maxor



Phase 2.7:
Necron: 'Each of my generals continues to disappoint. Take the loot or be prepared to fight Maxor.'

Loot you can get:
Fluorescent Flower: Crafting 9 of these forms the Flowing Flower of Power. This is a better version of the flower of truth that has a limit of 15 chained mobs and costs 200 mana per usage.
Sadan Goggles - Sadan Robes - Sadan Leggings - Sadan Boots: This is an upgraded necromancer lord set.
Super Serum
Ultra Legion - Just legion but 5x better

Maxor Fight:
I'm leaving this empty because we haven't seen the Maxor fight. I don't want to make any assumptions.





Spoiler: Phase 2.8 - Goldor



Phase 2.8:
Necron: Maxor was too young to fight properly. Lets see you up against Goldor, one of the most experienced in my army! Take the loot or be prepared for mortal combat.

Goldor Fight:
I'm leaving this empty because we haven't seen the Maxor fight. I don't want to make any assumptions.





Spoiler: Phase 2.9 - Storm



Phase 2.9
Necron: If Storm doesn't stop you now, I'll be forced to deal with you myself. Take the loot while you still can.

Storm Fight:
I'm going to be putting my interpretation of the Storm fight here. Subject to change when Storm gets released.

Storm: I'm mad. I'm so mad! I feel so cold. So hot. I'm fired up! Prepare to die.

Storm is a sociopath elementalist. with multiple personalities. Every 20 seconds, he changes his personality and the manner of the fight will change.

Windy Storm:
When Storm is in his Wind phase, he sends arrows flying from every direction and anvils falling from the ceiling, meanwhile smiting you with lightning.

Fiery Storm:
When Storm is in his Fiery state, he summons Magma bosses and ghasts from the ceiling to attack you.

Liquid Storm:
When Storm is in his Liquid state, he summons Sea Emperors and Great White Sharks to attack you.

Stonewall Storm:
When Storm is in his Stonewall state, he summons Gaia Constructs and such to attack you.

Killing Storm ends Phase 2 YES LMAO WE'RE STILL IN PHASE 2 . 



Pre-Phase 3:
Necron: DISAPPOINTMENTS! All of them. Nothing but disappointing. Take the loot or die.

Storm Loot:
well i dont know lmao wait for them to make the loot table



PHASE 3
Necron himself finally joins the battle. He's ready to roll. He charges a lightning attack for one minute, while summoning swarms of mobs to fight you. If he charges up fully, he starts laughing and completely kills one player at random. The only way to subvert his lightning is to stand on 5 pressure plates behind him, which restarts his charge. Killing all of the mobs forces Necron to fight you himself, where he shoots wither skulls and smites everyone occasionally dealing true damage.

PHASE 4 
When Necron is at 50% HP, he goes berserk. This mechanic comes back:
The 5 states are:
Necron: Your blades fall to my splendour! No-one but a mage could leave a scratch on me!
Necron: Your health pales in comparison to mine! No-one but a tank could hurt my pride!
Necron: Your weapons lay decaying from my wonderful barrier! Nothing but an arrow from an Archer could leave a scar!
Necron: Your magic is useless against me! Unless a berserker struck me with his sword, I should be immortal!
Necron: Your healing is so inferior! Only a healer could damage my reputation!

Every mob in the game is summoned all at once (Ranging from a chicken to the Woke Golem to every single boss in the catacombs) and you will have to kill them all. All this while, Necron is still charging his lightning blast. If all the mobs are killed, Necron fights you himself, shooting thrice as fast and smiting way more.

PHASE 5
When Necron is at 20% HP, he attempts to negotiate with the players.
Necron: You're doing well. I'll give you the chance to open the Obsidian Chest behind me if you end the run here. Just open the chest.

Opening the chest will instantly kill all of the players.
GEEEEET DUNKEDD ONNNN

Hitting Necron will continue the fight. He removes all the blessing buffs from the players and de-equips all their pets. Shuffles their inventory, freezes them in place, and summons even more frozen adventurers and shadow assassins.

PHASE 6
When Necron is at 10% HP, he goes crazy and summons 25 Shadow Assassins. He charges up for 3 minutes, meaning at the end of 3 minutes, every single player dies. If the players manage to kill the Shadow Assassins, Necron finally comes out and fights them, being EXTREMELY POWERFUL.

If you defeat Necron after all of this, congratulations! You deserve it from me and from necron.

Necron: You... You puny adventurers.. I'll get you for this! You hear me, I will! You'll never survive in the (insert next dungeon name here). My friend (insert friends name here) will make sure of it! *necron warps out*


Spoiler: Loot from Necron



Loot:
Necron's Skull: You managed to sever off one of his three heads. Might as well wear it. Increases rate of gaining Catacombs EXP by 20% along with other stats
Necron's Ribcage: You managed to rip out his ribcage. Why not wear it? Increases rate of gaining Catacombs EXP by 20% along with other stats
Necron's Leggings: He wears leggings? Increases rate of gaining Catacombs EXP by 20% along with other stats
Necron's Boots: Wait, doesn't he float? Increases rate of gaining Catacombs EXP by 20% along with other stats

Necron's Sceptre: This shoots wither skulls that explode. Best mage weapon in existence for clearing rooms
Necron's Crossbow: This is just a really powerful bow that does TRUE DAMAGE!. Great for archers
Necron's Cutlass: An incredibly powerful sword that gives you 300 ferocity.
Necron's Beating Heart: An upgrade to the plasmaflux which does NOT require Wolf 7 but instead Catacombs lvl 45.
Necron's Slammer: A sword which stuns enemies when you hit them. Damage and stun duration amplified as Tank.

And other stuff too! Its up to the admins.





Spoiler: Some ideas I had for loot



Impatient - Ultimate Enchant - Gain 1/2/3/4/5% extra damage on your next hit for each second since your last attack, up to a max of 20/40/60/80/100% extra damage.

Overdrive - Ultimate Enchant - The cooldown of this weapon goes down 10/20/30/40/50%.

Arm for an Arm - Ultimate Enchant - Take 50% more damage from all sources. Deal 40/80/120/160/200% of that damage reflected as true damage to the next enemy you hit. Cooldown of 2 seconds.

Soul Piercer - Tank Weapon - This weapon deals its damage + your ehp as true damage per hit.

Pacifism - Ultimate Enchant - Take 10/20/30/40/50% less damage and deal 35% less damage.

Greed - Ultimate Enchant - Gain 2/4/6/8/10 Magic Find.

Overpowering - Ultimate Enchant - Deal 10/20/30/40/50% more damage and take 100% more damage.

Broken Claw - Reforge Stone - (Legendary) Adds 35 Ferocity to the weapon.


SOME CLOSING NOTES:
Upon killing a Necron Converted Boss i.e. Bonzo v2, you do NOT have to fight it again if ALL 5 PLAYERS have killed Bonzo v2. Instead, Bonzo v2 can be fought in the Master Mode for F1. Same goes for all the floors.
Super Serum does NOT NOT NOT NOT NOT work in the overworld.
Its meant to take hours to complete everything. Notably, all of the resurrected bosses wont be fought more than once (unless you want to farm the items or the Super Serum in Master Mode.) so it wont actually take so long youd want to die
THERE IS NO POSSIBLE WAY TO FINISH THIS IN ONE SHOT. NO POSSIBLE WAY. You at LEAST need super serum and the items from the revived bosses



Spoiler: EDIT: Master Mode F10



since people were continually asking for F11 or a glitched F10 boss, here it is. master mode f10. I intend this to be extremely difficult.

Necron: You dare return? After you disgraced me so badly? Enough is enough. This is the end for you.
*Necron takes a crystal and fuses with it (this is a Soul Orb).* This should be enough to defeat you. I am now immortal! I am almighty! I am... EXALTED!

EXALTED NECRON Phase 1 
Exalted Necron is extremely powerful. Throughout the boss room there are five archwizards who all have a beam connected to Necron. They respawn within 30 seconds of being killed, and all immediately respawn if someone dies. They cannot attack but are instead really tanky. As long as even one is alive, Necron is immune.

While his archwizards are alive, he does the following attacks:

The pattern of the floor is a checkerboard pattern with three colours. Every so often, Necron will choose one colour at random and strike lightning on it dealing true damage. This will be indicated by the block turning red. Thats right, for every three blocks, one lightning will strike. 

Necron just straight up kills everyone in a 3 block radius from him. Yeah dont go near him while he's Exalted.

Necron summons hordes of skeletor primes to attack you.

Necron goes to the middle of the room and starts shooting arrows in a spiralling motion. For example look at this +.The dot in the middle of the + would be Necron and the lines would be arrows dealing true damage, moving in a circular motion.

When his archwizards are inactive they take one minute to respawn. He strikes lightning on two blocks instead of one, and twice as frequently. He sends wither skulls flying in every direction and blinds players, shuffles their inventory, teleports them to random places in the room, and just messes with them. He goes back into that specific phase where only one class can hit him at a time. 

Getting Necron to 20% HP makes him send you all to a void in an attempt to stop you from killing him. One player will remain in the boss room (spirit leaps disabled) and he fights one player at a time for 30 seconds each.

Obviously, he would do some more cool things but I have a test in like 4 days so I'll stop here. 

Loot:
I can't give any loot, but at least one I must say:
Soul Orb: Applies the Exalted reforge (Only chestplates) - + x defence and + x health. Bonus Ability: EXALTED! You are Exalted, and everything fears you. You are untouchable! You have 10 charges, one charge recharges in 10 seconds. Taking a hit nullifies the damage and loses one charge.


I hope you enjoyed my huge high effort post. I couldve made probably 10mil by now but instead I typed this down. Like the post if you like the post, and dislike it if you dont. Bump it if you want others to see it.

title: Turbo-Cacti for Cactus Contest is Impractical
body:
I'd just like to preface this by saying for those trying to earn gold in the Cactus contest, I was able to do it with Farming lvl 32 with a lvl 94 leg elephant and 21 cactus 7 minions, with a comfortable 4k lead. 

However, my first attempt (with a level 75 elephant), I came 400 cactus short of hitting gold. Afterwards, I realized that the hoe I was using (rare wheat hoe) didn't have turbo-cacti on it. Upon trying to anvil Turbo-Cacti 4 onto my hoe, I realized that it was incompatible. Turns out, Turbo-Cacti can only be applicable to axes. Nevertheless, Harvesting 5, is inapplicable to axes. Meaning, by sacrificing the use of a hoe with harvesting 5 (62.5% to double drops), you are replacing your tool with something that only gives a 25% double drop chance.

Effectively, doesn't this make the Turbo-Cacti enchant useless?

If anyone knows a solution to this, where I can have turbo-cacti as well as harvesting on the same tool, please tell me

title: Comprehensive guide for Mages, All budgets, All catacombs levels - Open for suggestions
body:
Hello skyblock players. Are you a mage? Do you want to be a mage? Are you LCM or RCM? Are you wondering whether you SHOULD go LCM or RCM? What does RCM or LCM mean? This guide includes everything you need to know about mages, how to play the class, how to play WITH the class and the terminologies used within our little mage community. Through testing I have found a few things that are really good but hidden under the eye lid of skyblock players, that can instantly boost ur mage experience. Let's get started!

First of all, what is LCM or RCM? The term LCM means left-click mage, which is essentially where a player uses berserker talisman reforges, mage armor reforges and berserker weapons to use the mage beam and attack mobs. Many of the top players use this setup, which can be extremely powerful, and WAS the best mage setup before the addition of the midas staff. However, it is only good if 1. You are rich (300m - 700m), or 2. You are extremely high catacombs lvl (30 - 35). I don't recommend anyone to go LCM unless you are in one of those categories.

What is RCM? RCM is right-click mage, or the mage that we all know. This type of mages are a lot more common in floors 1 -5 and you will most likely only see LCMs in Floor 6 in high-catacombs groups. This type of mages are really flexible in the gear that they can choose, as well as just being fun to play.

Guide: What gear do I get?
Now this part is difficult; because everyone has different budgets and different catacombs lvls. I'll be listing a few of the prototypes here, but if your situation is not on the list, ask it in the comment section and I'll help you, as well as adding your situation onto the guide.
I will not be including budget / low catacombs lvl setups; Frozen scythe, zombie soldier / dark goggles or bonzo mask, sheep pet. Never go bonzo staff.

Catacombs 16 - 20, budget of 20m - 30m
Frozen scythe 5 starred.
Super heavy chestplate
Necromancer lord leggings
Spirit boots
Legendary sheep pet lvl 70+

Catacombs 21 - 24, budget of 31m - 50m
Spirit sceptre
Frozen scythe 5 starred
Same armor as before, but with necromancer lord boots, and if you wish to do f6 use giant reforge on chestplate. Maybe use a mender fedora in boss fight.

Catacombs 21 - 25, budget of 50m - 70m
10 - 20 / 30m Midas staff, only use if you are catacombs 25 or above, OR if you are catacombs 24 and you'll probably get catacombs 25 soon.
^ is surprisingly good, when dungeonised is about 2x better than 5 star yeti, for about the same cost and way lower catacombs level requirement.
Same stuff as before, but use t9 / t10 chestplate and it's your choice if you wish to keep the frozen scythe or not. I didn't, but I recommend you to.

Catacombs 26 - 29, budget of 70m - 110m
Same weapons, but change 2/4 necromancer lord to wise dragon armor if you wish for more damage.
You may also switch to tierboosted enderdragon if you have the money.
Yeti sword is a waste of time quote @GamingDevil 

Catacombs 30 or above is where LCM because relevant. If you are still wishing to be RCM, use an 100m Midas staff.
Otherwise,
Livid dagger
5 star Tarantula helmet with 3/4 shadow assassin
Legendary ender dragon (TB or non TB doesn't really matter)
Livid dagger (Giant's sword may work but I prefer livid)
Spirit sceptre
Armor on necrotic / loving, talismans on shaded, sword on fabled.

Now, what do I need to be aware of when playing WITH a mage?
Mages tend to have quite the ego. The ego might help them if they know what they are doing, but if they don't, do not get in an argument with them. You will lose brain cells.
Also, Mages like to solo things. So take care of your baby mages. If they are good, let them run free. If they aren't, either be careful and help them, or
/p leave, /warp dungeon_hub, /ignore add *mage*


Please leave suggestions! No hate towards anyone, only here to help.
IF you leave a reaction, please comment why!

title: How You Can Get ENCHANTING 50 FAST
body:
After 8-10 long and hard hours, I got enchanting 50. Now you might be thinking that 8-10 hours for enchanting 50 is extremely long, but actually, if you do the math, at 9 hours for 55.5m exp is ~6.2m per hour including breaks. This is because I used the surprisingly unpopular "Skypixel" mod that changes the enchanting table menu to the vanilla one (link: here *please note this is not my mod and all credit for this mod goes to the creator, prplz, lots of love to him*) Also, make sure you are obviously using level 95-100 epic/leg guardian, exp 4 potion WITH Viking tear, and exp boost 3 pot (basically a god potion, but not everyone uses those) + obviously a booster cookie. If you aren't going to 50, and even if you are, I'd highly recommend barrowing a pet, not buying, unless you get some absurdly low price. Also, a tip for people who struggle with double splashing, find a good dpi AND sensitivity. DPI affects IN menu and outside of menu moving, sensitivity is just outside moving. Also obviously use auto or large GUI scale.
Another quick thing while I'm at it, DO NOT, I AM SERIOUS, DO NOT GO FROM 0-50 IN 1 SITTING. It seriously hurts your hand and can cause LASTING HAND CRAMPS, I KNOW FROM EXPERIENCE. If you have the materials, go from 0-35 to 43/44 THEN to 50, a lot easier.
Anyway, go to the corner of the bookshelves and crouch a bit nearer to the crafting table, it helps you get closer and helps you double splash less. If you have bad ping, first of all you're screwed, and second of all make sure to time it correctly so you can anticipate when the enchantment table will open and close so you can make a rhythm that works for you. Also if enchanting frustrates you, I'd highly recommend doing it one hour at a time, personally helped me get used to it. Other than that, you should be good! Just have fun and maybe time yourself to see how fast you can get Arthritis...


I mean clear out a stack of grands!

title: why forge is getting less fps then other clients
body:
I usually play on blc because of its decent mods and pretty good fps. (Lunar gives less fps.) I only use forge for dungeons since it has very good mods, but little fps. But the more i play dungeons, the less fps i get. And after awhile, i run out of memory and then all textures turn white, then mc crashes. So I have 2 reasons why this is happening.

1. Minecraft is taking up most of my gpu/cpu/memory

I have used task manager to find this information.
These are the main apps i usually have.




From this image, we can see that Minecraft (Java(TM) Platform SE Binary) has aa whopping 2900 megabytes (2.9 gigabytes), 25% of my cpu/gpu, and is taking up a very large amount of the power coming from my battery. The second most app that is taking the most of my computer is Chrome. Only taking up 180 megabytes, 2% of my cpu and 0% of my gpu. As well as taking up a very small amount of energy. Since Chrome is known for taking up a good amount of space, the next app is Discord. Taking up only 90 megabytes, 0% of cpu/gpu, and a small amount of power. I really dont know why this is happening but it really doesn't seem like MC is supposed to take up almost 3 gigs. This really doesn't have much evidence on its own, so were going to the next reason why this is happening. Mods

2. Using a lot of mods may affect the fps.
I use Refraction's mod folder v4 with some minor adjustments. Here are the mods I use.







I've heard about some mods affecting fps, but I don't know which ones. If you know, please tell me. People have also said that patcher makes a lot of difference, although for me it doesn't seem like it is. Tell me again how I can fix that.

Conclusion: I really don't know why this is happening. And I REALLY don't wanna play dungeons on blc. So any support would be great.

title: My Idea- PvP Tourneys (Eliminates Pay-2-Win!)
body:
For too long now has the Coliseum has been "Disabled for renovations". It is time we bring it back better than ever! Introducing...

THE WARRIOR'S GAUNTLET

"The Warrior's Gauntlet" allows people to enjoy a PvP experience in Skyblock in a Balanced and Fair way. It is separated into 3 Leagues, being the Little League, Warrior's League, and Master's League. These Leagues all have their own rules and restrictions to balance out our favorite gameplay mechanics while also making PvP still a fun experience. I'll list the specifics here.

The Basics-

When speaking to the Gladiator at Spawn, he will give you 2 options. The 1st will be "Tourney" while the 2nd will be "Private Match". Once selecting 1 of the 2 options, you will see 3 more. They will say "Little League", "Warrior's League", and "Master's League". Selecting one of these in the "Tourney" option will search for 7 more players with around the same leaderboard score as you in that specific League. Selecting one of these in the "Private Match" option will let you choose how many people are in a respected match, allowing you to create a tourney with the people in your party. Once in the match in any game mode, you will have 1 minute to choose 1 armor set that you have in your wardrobe to use for the match. You will NOT be able to interchange between armor sets. Once everyone is ready, a 5 minute timer will start and the battle will begin! May luck and skill be on your side!

The Leagues-

The different types of Leagues are very important towards the balancing of this PvP system. As I said before, each League has it's own restrictions and rules. I will go over them individually.

Little League

Players can only use Common, Uncommon, and Rare Armor Sets and Weapons.
Each Player's Fairy Souls are set to 0 and Talismans are disabled.
Zombie Swords and Power Orbs of ANY KIND are unusable.
Critical Chance is set to 10%.
Enderpearls, the Weird Tuba, and Grappling Hooks are unusable.

The Little League is meant to be for Beginners. We wouldn't want anyone with Lapis Armor up against someone in Superior, now would we? Now let's talk about the Warrior's League.

Warrior's League

Players can only use Common, Uncommon, Rare, and Epic Armor Sets and Weapons.
Each Player's Fairy Souls are set to 100 and Talismans are disabled.
The Florid Zombie Sword, Mana Flux Power Orb, Overflux Power Orb, and Plasma Flux Power Orb are unusable.
Critical Chance is set to 25%.
Enderpearls and the Weird Tuba are unusable.
The Warrior's League is meant for Midgame Players. As you can see, restrictions have loosened quite a bit, but they aren't too bad. Onto the Master's League.

Master's League

Player's can use any Rarity of Armor Sets and Weapons.
Each Player's Fairy Souls are set to the MAX and Talismans are disabled (I do this because people might have more talismans than others, which provides an unfair advantage).
No Healing Items are unusable.
Critical Chance is set to 50%.
All Items are usable.
The Master's League is meant for Endgame Players. Since they grinded so much for their gear, they should be allowed to use it.

The Leaderboards & Rewards-

Of course, no good PvP game mode on Hypixel doesn't give rewards, so I set up some rewards for each and every League!

Static Rewards

Coins |1k- Top 100,000|, |10k- Top 75,000|, |50k- Top 50,000|, |100k- Top 25,000|, |250k- Top 10,000|, |500k-Top 5,000|, |1m- Top 1,000|, |2.5m- 3rd Place|, |5m- 2nd Place|, |10m- 1st Place|
Badge Talismans |Wooden (Common)- Top 100,000|, |Copper (Uncommon)- Top 50,000|, |Silver (Rare)- Top 25,000|, |Gold (Epic)- Top 10,000|, |Platinum (Legendary)- Top 5,000|

Little League Rewards

Naive Shard (Rare) |1 Shard- Top 100,000|, |2 Shards- Top 75,000|, |3 Shards- Top 50,000|
Naive Warrior's Blade (Rare) |+100 Atk, +80 Strength, +50 Critical Damage, 150 Intelligence, Ability: Beginner's Promise (For 3 seconds, your hits will deal 25% more Damage. Costs 50 Mana.), Crafted Using 32 Naive Shards and a Stick, with 16 shards in the center and top-center of the crafting table and the stick at the bottom-center.|

Warrior's League Rewards

Skilled Shard (Epic) |1 Shard- Top 100,000|, |2 Shards- Top 75,000|, |3 Shards- Top 50,000|
Skilled Warrior's Blade (Epic) |+150 Atk, +100 Strength, +80 Critical Damage, 200 Intelligence, Ability: Warrior's Promise (For 3 seconds, your hits will deal 50% more Damage. Costs 100 Mana.), Crafted Using 32 Skilled Shards and a Stick, with 16 shards in the center and top-center of the crafting table and the stick at the bottom-center.|

Master's League Rewards

Masterful Shard (Legendary) |1 Shard- Top 100,000|, |2 Shards- Top 75,000|, |3 Shards- Top 50,000|
Masterful Warrior's Blade (Legendary) |+210 Atk, +150 Strength, +100 Critical Damage, 300 Intelligence, Ability: Master's Promise (For 3 seconds, your hits will deal 75% more Damage. Costs 150 Mana.), Crafted Using 32 Masterful Shards and a Stick, with 16 shards in the center and top-center of the crafting table and the stick at the bottom-center.|
Mini Gladiator Pet (Legendary) |(Lvl 100) 50+ Strength, +25 Critical Damage, +20 Attack Speed, +5 Ferocity, Ability 1: Fighting Spirit (When below Half HP, increase your Strength and Ferocity by 20%. Your attacks also cause enemies to bleed, making them lose 2% of their maximum HP every second for 5 seconds.), Ability 2: One with the Blade (Beginner's Promise, Warrior's Promise, and Master's Promise are extended to 5 seconds.), Ability 3: Dynamic Duo (This Pet Follows You Around and attacks enemies for you, dealing 25% of your Physical Damage. This ability doesn't work on players in the Tourney.)|, |Pet- Top 1,000|

title: Hypixel skyblock economy. - here is the major problem
body: I've always had keen interest in economy and how money flows. When i started to play skyblock i noticed the problem with its system of handling coins. You see, Skyblock's economy is different from the real life market. To put this simply, let's go back to the beginning of skyblock when the ember rods dwelled in hands of the rich. At that time, how much did the ember rod cost? Well, it cost few hundred thousand coins. Now, back to the present. If we look at Ah, the most expensive weapon, such as the midas sword, livid dagger and the daedalus axe costs FEW HUNDRED MILLION coins. So, what happened? well during the 1 year and half of skyblock, the economy had too much coins. Players can make millions of coins easily and that is the key problem. You see, if the economy has too much money, the value of money will drop. This is called an inflation. Currently, skyblock is at an all time high inflation and what matters more is that ITS GOING TO GET EVEN WORSE as players make more and more money. So, here is what i propose. We need to increase the value of coins. Whether that is by making money making harder or just decrease the amount of money in market.

title: <My Skyblock [Ideas]> - Cause why not
body:
Okay, over the past days I have had some ideas to add to skyblock and I want to share them with you all!

Ultimate Enchants:
1. Unbreakable (Craftable):
Unbreakable could be an Ultimate that reduces durability damage a dungeon item takes. It would go up to 5 levels like every other Ultimate. Yes, it should be craftable. It would be 32 enchanted obsidian around 64 enchanted paper, however this gives you the 2nd level of the item. It would be the last collection in the obsidian collection. The Unbreakable 1-5 enchants should also be found in dungeons 1-6. F1 could give Unbreakable 1, F2 could give Unbreakable 1-2, F3 could give Unbreakable 2-3, F4 could give Unbreakable 3-4, and etc. 

2. Length (Not Craftable)
Length would be an Ultimate that adds slight reach to an item. Each Length level adds .5 blocks of reach. This also goes to level 5. You can find them in floors 3-6. F3 is Length 1, F4 is Length 2, F5 is Length 3-4, F6 is Length 4-5.

Items:
So, we can all agree that the nether rack collection is lacking, right? Well, this idea adds 5 brand new items. The first is enchanted nether rack which is unlocked at 1.5k collection. This is worthless, but is used to craft the next item, enchanted nether bricks(5k collection). Again useless, but is used to make enchanted nether brick blocks(10k collection). This item IS useful as it crafts the frying pan (20k collection). I am not sure the stats of this weapon, but I know that it should have a variant at 100k collection called burning frying pan.

Tell me what you think! (also what should the frying pan do?)

title: is it just me or is skyblock eating me
body:
So when I first started on sb I was shocked how cool and fancy the menus and quests and hubs were, so I got my friend to play with me and make a co-op. Everything was great until we decided to grind eyes. Before we did whatever we wanted fish? Okay. Grind lapis zombies with the skyblock menu? Sounds great! But then we couldn’t manage to get enough damage so we decided to go for talismans, ever since then I felt like I had to grind foraging and combat and talismans, I didn’t want to, I wanted to have fun with my friend. But I spent hours and made my friend do it too, foraging combat mining minions talismans. It was stressful, the days literally felt shorter, it would get really hot and I didn’t even feel excitement when logging on, then my friend got tired and slowly drifted to other games, when alpha was released he was gone, but I wanted to progress and show him that we could still have fun, but he stopped responding to me. I think he got sick of seeing my texts, and I didn’t even feel my arms anymore I would play 12 hours a day non stop, it hurt to get out of that position I would play in, so I decided to take a break focus on school but after 30 mins away from skyblock it just got really hot and I couldn’t even think properly, I’m not kidding I literally had to buy an extra fan to cool me down, as soon as I got back on skyblock I immediately started thinking of prices of items and how much of each slayer you should do during what time of day I thought of how many resources a coal minion could make in a month and I started to play vanilla and I froze for 5 mins trying to find out where the stupid menu was, and I also sit with my legs folded on top of my desk with my back grinding against my chair like this -> (
So my legs hurt like **** PLEASE HELP ME. (Also I can’t stop wasting money on enchanted ores)

title: Shredder is better than ROTS when maxed
body:
The new update added a new type of item called fishing weapons, which are basically fishing rods that you can put sword enchants on. Shredder has now become reclassified as a fishing weapon, meaning you can now put any enchant you would put on a sword on the shredder.
How does this make shredder overtake ROTS, you ask? Well, there's a ultimate enchant you can put on swords, but not rods, that increases your sea creature chance with the right pet - the chimera enchantment. With a max level dolphin, granting +5 scc, and a washed up souvenir, adding +5 scc to the pet, a Shredder with Chimera 5 grants +10 scc. That's 3 more than ROTS.
Of course, you're paying like 100 million for +3% chance to get a rare sea creature. But you are playing Hypixel Skyblock, so...

title: Limit the daily available playtime in The Dragon's Nest (Read before you scream.)
body:
The Dragon’s Nest is a land void of happiness. It is full of despair, anger, sadness, addiction, and hopelessness. Every day, people waste hours upon hours of their lives sweating the dragon’s nest, desperately seeking anything that can get them further ahead in the game, even if it means hurting other people in the process.

I think something seriously needs to happen to the dragon’s nest in terms of allowed playtime in it. There’s no way that it can keep going on the way it is without there being serious consequences to kids in real life. This addiction that most have to grinding Zealots in the Dragon’s Nest is affecting their lives in really bad ways. Lots of them purposefully miss online classes just to partake in it. Increasing anger over stolen kills, slowly developing depression from the absolute nothing that it brings to someone’s emotional and mental health state, etc.

My proposal is to introduce a time limit per day for players when it comes to the Dragon’s Nest. This is the only way that I can see any of this being fixed. Make no mistake, I’m extremely aware of how unpopular this is gonna be to a lot of people. I realize that I will likely be called very bad names by several people for me even thinking to suggest this, but I think it’s crucial that it be brought up.

2 different 3 hour spans a day, the Dragon’s Nest would be open to all players, 3 hours in the morning, and 3 hours in the evening/night time, to hopefully cater to multiple time zones across the world, and to also allow most kids to be able to play without interrupting their online classes, or in person classes.

I think by introducing this limited playtime, it would turn into sort of a Grinch Simulator effect, where people can actually have fun in the Dragon’s Nest, knowing that they only get a limited amount in it per day. I think the hostile atmosphere will be dramatically less, as you won’t get anyone who’s been in there the past 15 hours no sleep, and I think that it will shine the spotlight on more areas of Skyblock that most players probably might not be familiar with, like Dungeons and Farming and Revenants, etc.

Now, keep in mind, this would apply to the Dragon’s Nest ONLY. The End Island as a whole will still be open at all times. That means you don’t have to worry about not being able to grind pets, combat levels, etc. Just the Dragon’s Nest, and more specifically, the Eyes.

Now, on top of this, these are the changes I propose happen to the Dragon’s Nest as a whole to hopefully counter some of the unavoidable changes that would happen with this being added.

1: Make Zealots spawn more frequently and often. 
-By increasing zealot rates drastically during the time the nest would be open, that will hopefully make eyes easier to get during the limited time, and hopefully counter out any economic change that would be brought forward by the nest being closed for most of the day.

2: Minimum player number of 10-15 per lobby.
-This one might be harder from a technical side, since this would mean more servers would be needed, but I think it could potentially be done.

3: Damage Cap on Dragons.
-This one simply has to happen. It’s unacceptable that players can do 16 million damage to dragons in 10 seconds. Have a 5 million damage cap, and everyone that reaches it has the same chance at winning some cool items. Make it more encouraging and welcoming for everyone.



Please let me know your thoughts, reactions, and concerns. I’ll try to respond to as many as I can.


EDIT: RESPONDING TO FREQUENTLY BROUGHT UP POINTS

So it’s been a hot minute since I posted this thread. A lot of responses have come in, and I wanted to say how pleasantly surprised I was at the reception to this thread. I was prepared for so many more dislikes, hate posts, attacking posts, etc.

Not only have there been a lot of supportive responses, but even the disagreement responses have been, for the most part, non aggressive, and actually explaining their reasoning for why they don’t like it, and I’m really grateful that we can have this discussion without any of that toxicity coming between us. I’ve seen some meme responses, non helpful responses, and attacks still, but that number is so far less what I thought it was gonna be.

Now, I want to try to respond to some of the majorly favorite points people are beginning up as best as I can. Keep in mind that I do not play this game for progression reasons. I play it for fun and enjoyment, and that may affect the way I see things, which may convince you guys to see me as “dumb” or “an idiot” or “out of your mind.” and that’s ok, as long as you’re respectful about it.


*People will sweat way more knowing they have a limited amount of time to grind in the End.

-This is what I hope the more frequent zealot spawns and the lesser number of players on islands will help to counter. I think the thing now is that there are too few zealots and too many players per island. If we tweak those things, it shouldn’t really change much if some people are a little more sweaty, cause the more frequent zealot spawns and less players should evenly balance that out.


*Kids will have to specifically play at a certain time, meaning they actually will miss things and it will have the opposite effect.

Not really, at least I don’t think. Cause with those 6 hours that you’d have in Dragon’s Nest, that still leaves you with 18 hours left in the day, Let’s assume you sleep about 8 hours a day, that’s still 10 hours that you have to work on other things in real life that you can do worry free. If you need to schedule your day around the dragon’s nest being open at a specific time, and you’re using your other time to do school work and hang out with your family and such, I think that ends up working out much better for you then simply being online the entire day in the dragon nest.

Regarding “Kids will still miss their classes” I tried to pick the times that are most likely to occur when most kids are not in a class. My specific times that I don’t think I mentioned in the thread were 4-7 PM EST and 4-7 AM EST, before most school starts, and after most school ends. Of course, there’s never gonna be a perfect timespan where every single kid doesn’t have class and is free for 3 hours straight, so I always knew this was gonna be a hard one to find a perfect thing for. I think those times I picked will be the best.


*Hypixel should not be the ones to limit playtime, it should be their parents.

-Unfortunately, we’re in a time where parents aren’t really doing such a great job. If it were the case, then I definitely wouldn’t have to suggest it, but here we are. People are right when they say it is not Hypixel’s responsibility to keep track of how long kids are playing online, but I think the server can set a good example for other online communities, and maybe even win more parent support for doing it.


I think those are the big 3. I’ll keep reading to find more.

title: Skyblock in D&D(1)
body:
Hi everyone, SnowMinionT11 here, and I've decided to make Dungeons and Dragons items for skyblock, corresponding as best as I can. Let's start.
Superior Dragon Armor is going to be based off of Mithral Scale Mail. This mimics a dragons scales. Ordinarily, this would hinder movement, but Superior doesn't do that in game, so we're using mithral. Mithral armor removes the movement and dexterity penalties for wearing heavy or medium armor. We're going to give it a buff to AC as well, and bonus on ability checks for the set bonus.
So our final stats are:
Superior Dragon Armor: Legendary Armor
AC 17
+2 to ability checks.
All around, good, and viable for every class! 
Voodoo Doll:
Interestingly, voodoo dolls already exist in DND as random trinkets. Let's try something else.

As a bonus action, you may trigger this doll while it is in your hand. If you do, pick an enemy up to 120 feet away that you can see. That target must make a DC 18 dexterity save. On a hit, 8 magical arrows appear around the target. Each arrow deals 1d8 damage initially and deals 8d4 force damage per round for 5 rounds. On a miss, the target must make a DC 10 wisdom save or become frightened for 1 round. This doll has 15 charges that reset after you take a long rest.

Pretty nasty overall. The fear is because, well, magic arrows materializing around you trying to impale you is happening.

Silent Death:
This seems like something good for rogues, so I'll heavily nerf this to prevent a complete massacre.

Silent Death:Rare Shortsword
Prerequisites: Assasin Rogue Subclass
As a move action, you may disappear into the Shadowfell. The next round, you appear behind your opponent in an empty space, or if there is no empty space, the target is pushed. Using this ability grants combat advantage, and allows you to add 1d8 to your next attack on any attacks this round. If the target is pushed, you do not get combat advantage.

What do you guys want to see?

title: Closing the debate on me and iDobie
body:
In the past few weeks, me and @iDobie have been in a dispute on forums over matters that could've been handled better. On both of our behalves, I'd like to ask those of you with some sense of reason to put the matter to rest, on here, Discord, YouTube, wherever. If you know anything about what happened, keep it to yourself, no matter how important you think it is. Both of us are sick of this fighting, and we've worked out a compromise that we're both fine with. All I ask from the rest of you is to not send hate towards either of us for any reason. Toxicity over this kind of stuff tends to get out of hand quickly if not put to a halt, and death threats of any kind over a block game are a bit much.

We both know our errors, and my only wish is for this to be resolved peacefully.

I hope you all understand,
- Hypernova642

title: Suggested Endermite Pet Rework
body:
Endermite Pet is pretty useless now.

Here are its current stats at level 100 (screen shot from the wiki):





Why the first perk is useless:
1. No one mines end stone unless it is during the mining event.
2. If they do mine during the mining event they would be using a silverfish pet for more mining xp as the mining event doubles mining xp on public islands.

Why the second perk is useless:
1. Sacks are cheaper than crafting this pet.
2. Sacks do not have to be leveled up, so selling ender pearls from a sack will make as much money per ender pearl as a decently leveled endermite pet.
3. Everyone else uses Sacks, so you cannot pick up ender pearls on the ground very often (this makes the second change this pet got a hard nerf).

Why the third perk is useless:
1. Everyone grinding zealots is likely already using a God Potion and has hit Max Speed already.



My suggestions for a rework:
(These are probably not very balanced but I tried)
(Level 100 Legendary)

Base Stats:
+100 intelligence (+1 per level)
+20 speed (+1 every 5 levels/+0.2 per level)

Why extra speed - Endermites are small and why not.

1st perk:

Endermite Friend: You can no longer attack endermites, and they will not target you. (Does not upgrade per level)

Why this perk - Endermites are annoying to hit.

2nd perk:

Pearl Finder: Gain +50% chance (+1% chance every 2 levels/+0.5% chance per level) to get 100% more pearls (2x) when you kill an enderman or zealot.

Why this perk - keeps the original intention of the pet, which is to get more money from endermen/zealots while you are grinding. The difference is that this perk works with a sack while the current perk works against a sack. (This perk may need a nerf).

3rd perk:

Zealot Hunter: Gain 10% more damage to zealots (+1% every 10 levels/+0.1% per level). After killing a zealot, gain 25 speed (+1 every 4 levels/+0.25 per level)(increases speed cap by amount given), 10 strength (+1 every 10 levels/+0.1 per level), 20 intelligence(+1 every 5 levels/+0.2 per level), and jump boost 4 for 20 seconds.

Why this perk - This pet can be useful for helping newer players kill zealots, or older players who don't want to use a god potion. (This perk may need a nerf).



I feel these perks would buff the endermite pet to be more useful in the current state of the game.


Additional idea: Pet item to make endermite pet mythic rarity

Shiny Green Orb

Possible Drops (ideas):

1. RNG drop from Special Zealots (like 1/250 or something)

2.Drop from Old Dragons.

Adds 4th perk:

Precious Pearls:

Increase Pearl Finder pearl chance to 100% and increase the amount of pearls to 200% more pearls.
Upon getting an Enchanted Ender Pearl as a rare drop, you will gain an additional 20 coins. For an Enchanted Eye of Ender, you will gain an additional 350 coins. (This does not consume the Enchanted Ender Pearl or Enchanted Eye of Ender).



This probably isn't balanced, but this pet was so useful and good on release, then they nerfed him twice, and added new stuff that made him more useless and I want it to be useful again.

If you have any suggestions let me know.

title: Something I Need To Say
body:
Recently, @sykese made a post about restricting the amount of time players can spend in the Dragon's Den. The idea itself didn't get me thinking, it was his reasoning that makes me need to post this thread. And its one simple reason: THIS IS JUST A VIDEO GAME.
There are a lot of people who play Skyblock and do nothing else. It isn't healthy to be this obsessed over a game. There are many better things to do with your life. To those who grind Skyblock a huge amount, I want to say something to you specifically: spend a day without Skyblock. Spend time with your friends and family. Maybe do some writing or drawing and bring out your creative side. Maybe even get a boyfriend/girlfriend to spend time with. ANnything to help you not waste so much time on Skyblock.
Thank you for reading this.

title: What event is easy to make 1M+ Coins in/During?
body:
What event is easy to make 1M+ Coins in/During?

One of the easiest Events, on Hypixel Skyblock, to make 1M+ Coins on, is the Season Of Jerry Event, and here is why...
___________________________________________________________________________________________________________
Gifts
During the Season Of Jerry event, you can warp to the island, and find 20 White Gifts, for free. Those 20 sell for approximately 100-120k coins. Then you get a Green gift. Which is worth around 10K Coins. That's an easy 1-130k+ Coins from less than 10 minutes of work! (and you have fun while making money!) You can also use the gifts to try and get a Snow Minion!
___________________________________________________________________________________________________________
Chicken Race *NOTE* You can only do this once!
During the event, there is a big hill, not the volcano, it's the one behind the bank. Go on top of it and towards one of the sides you should see Gulliver The Chicken. Do the chicken race and you will get a Gift Compass (Worth 20-50K Coins!, a Red Gift (Worth 40k+ COINS!), and a Frozen Chicken Talisman.
That is an Easy 80K+ (if you sell the gift compass which I don't recommend, you should keep it to find the gifts.
___________________________________________________________________________________________________________
Snow Minions
For this one, you will either need a snow minion or 5-700k+ Coins, This is more for people with more coins. 
Step One: Buy a Snow Minion (Preferably Tier 1.)
Step Two: Buy 16 Stacks of Snow Blocks and 4 Stacks of Enchanted Snow Blocks. (Usually costs 157k+/- coins.)
Step Three: Upgrade it to tier 11
Step Four: Sell it for 950k+
Step Five: Make a 250K+ Profit!
___________________________________________________________________________________________________________
Fishing 
This one I do not reccomend, but if you have a good rod it can be very profitable, so I heard. I never do this one but I know you can catch Frosty, (Gives gifts),
The Grinch (gives gifts) and other fishing stuff. This is a biased opinion because I do not like fishing but you can for sure make a profit with it,
__________________________________________________________________________________________________
The Actual Event
This is probably, one of the best methods out of all. There is 4-5 Rounds, Each round Magma Cubes, and magma troops spawn, focus on the magma cubes. If you do enough damage, you get a lot of gifts, (7-10 White 7-10 Green 1-2 Red) Most of the time. Therefore, after 4-5 Rounds you will have 8-10 Red gifts, Which sell for 40k+ each, 30-40 Green gifts, Which sell for 10k+ each, and 30-40 white gifts, which sell for 5k+ each.
___________________________________________________________________________________________________________
My Conclusion is, There are many methods, and if you can try to do all of these, There are more that I did not list, but these are the easiest ones, in my opinion, feel free to share your money-making methods! And if this helped you, Please recommend more events for me to cover!
_________________________________________________________________________________________________________
-Ehxo

title: [GUIDE]Best Items To Flip in Bazaar (05/11/2020 - 05/13/2020)
body:
So hello! If you're new at bazaar flipping, listen to me carefully. If you're not, you can skip this part.
-----------------
-----------------
Hello! So you're new in Bazaar Flipping! Let me teach you how to Bazaar Flip.
First of all Bazaar Flipping is useful if you got 500k or more money.
Or else You will make 3k money in like 7-8 minutes.
But with 500k or more, you can make 15k to 20k in 10 seconds! (depends on the buy rate of the item you're selling)
So becareful! Dont try to flip the items that players dont buy much often!
Flipping is making a buy order and buying the item and then selling the item for more coins and making profit!
To make a buy order:
1) Click the item you want to make a buy order on it
2) Click the paper with black ink on it
3) Click how much you want to buy
4) Click the gold nugget to make it %1 better buy order (so people will buy it)
--------
--------
Then to make a sell order:
Just make the things that I said but click the white paper
-----------------------------------
-----------------------------------
So here it is! You just flipped an item!
--------------------------------------------
--------------------------------------------
Best items to flip (05/11/2020 - 05/13/2020):
Enchanted Jungle Wood
Enchanted Endstone
Enchanted Rotten Flesh
--------------------------
--------------------------
--------------------------
Thanks for reading this!
